alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 2:28AM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 9 inches for the valleys. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Further snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches in the valleys. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Valleys total snowfall through whole event of 3 to 15 inches. Mountains can see 1 to 3 feet of snowfall through whole event. * WHERE...Northwestern Nye County. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 10 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel is expected to very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow with significantly reduce visibility to white out conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is a very potent system that is at historic levels, travel and any outdoor activities is not advised.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
